feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 3:11PM AKDT until October 15 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Copper River Basin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 3:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Freezing Rain Possible Tonight and Sunday in the Interior... A strong storm in the Gulf of Alaska will send a weather front north into the Interior tonight bringing warmer temperatures along with some snow and a chance of freezing rain to the area. Freezing rain will mix with the snow so no accumulation is expected, but it will create slippery driving and walking
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 2:28PM AKDT until October 15 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility expected. East winds gusting to 45 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Over Dalton Highway Summits. * WHEN...From 6 AM to 10 PM AKDT today.

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued October 15 at 2:15PM AKDT until October 17 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT AKDT SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to midnight AKDT Sunday night.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 15 at 9:58PM CDT until October 15 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI...CENTRAL TIPTON AND SOUTHWESTERN LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 15 at 7:51PM MST until October 15 at 8:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 800 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued October 15 at 7:48PM MST until October 15 at 10:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 748 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Winters Wash. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.

entry.title: Freeze Watch issued October 15 at 9:29PM CDT until October 17 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27 to 29 possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central and southeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...From late Sunday night into Monday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW BEGINNING SUNDAY EVENING AND LASTING THROUGH MONDAY IN IRON AND ASHLAND COUNTIES... Lake effect snow showers are likely beginning Sunday evening and lasting through Monday in eastern Ashland County and throughout Iron County in northwestern Wisconsin. Two to five inches of snowfall is expected, but local amounts of six to eight inches
